citations.narrative:
During inspection a recently acquired wolf dog was not identified as required in the regulations. Groot, a 2 year old wolf-
dog hybrid acquired since the last inspection, was not identified with a tag, collar, tattoo or microchip at the time of
inspection. All other animals on the facility were identified with a microchip, in accordance with the standing variance for
microchips. An exhibitor shall identify all live dogs and cats under his or her control or on his or her premises, whether
held, purchased or otherwise acquired as set forth in the regulations.
Correct by 7 December 2025 or the next scheduled new site inspection.

All surfaces in housing facilities must be maintained on a regular basis. In the kitchen area, a table edge was worn, with
absorbent material exposed in an area where raw meat was prepared for consumption by the covered animals. The table
can no longer be effectively cleaned or sanitized, and needs to be maintained or replaced. In the opening between the
kitchen and the sheltered housing, the footing and kickplate had been damaged and exposed to water used to clean the
kitchen and kennels. Surfaces of housing facilities that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized, must be replaced or
repaired when worn or soiled.
Correct by 7 December 2025 or by next scheduled new site inspection.

In one of the outdoor primary enclosures, there is a floor adjacent to fenceline where the concrete has cracked creating a
a gap. The concrete crack and gap allows the wolf-dogs feet to pass through the opening/gap and potentially get caught,
causing injury. Primary enclosures must be structurally sound and kept in good repair to prevent injury to the covered
animals contained within.
Correct by 7 December 2025 or the next scheduled new site inspection.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
